title: 'It's a process': CBS committed to Ten's Aussie content
text:
CBS global distribution chief executive Armando Nunez said the US media giant is committed to the Ten Network for the long haul, and has trumpeted the network's investment in original Australian content.

Mr Nunez led the US studio and network's purchase of Ten out of administration in 2017. He said CBS had made significant progress in its two years owning Ten, which could in part be measured by the number of shows returning for new seasons.

CBS international boss Armando Nunez with Ten CEO Paul Anderson. Yianni Aspradakis

"The continual investment the company has made in content, I don’t think Ten has had a period of time where it has had this much original programming and this much investment in content, Australian content," Mr Nunez said.

"CBS has been tremendously supportive of Ten and the Australian media sector."

While there is a limit to what CBS will invest in Ten, the US company has not made any management changes since taking over and has given Ten a more secure financial backing that it had when it was a listed entity.
description: CBS global distribution chief executive Armando Nunez said the US media giant is committed to the Ten Network long term.
